title: PR / Media Director Job at Choice Talents NG
content:
Choice Talents NG is Nigeria’s preferred talents management company. Our goal is to help build successful businesses through effective talent, resource and process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: PR / Media Director
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Job


	We are looking for a very senior editor well experienced with print, radio and TV media, to manage the public relations responsibilities of an international NGO.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and maintain strong relationships with key media outlets, journalists, and influencers to secure positive press coverage.
	Draft and distribute press releases, media advisories, and pitch materials.
	Respond to media inquiries and coordinate media interviews with company spokespeople.
	Develop and implement crisis communication plans and manage communication during sensitive or critical situations.
	Act as the company’s spokesperson during a crisis, providing clear, timely, and accurate information to the media.
	Write press releases, articles, speeches, blog posts, op-eds, articles, and other communication materials as needed.
	Work with senior leadership to develop and execute PR strategies that align with the company’s goals and objectives.
	Establish and maintain a clear and consistent voice for the brand across all communication channels.
	Provide strategic counsel to executives on media interactions and public appearances.
	Oversee the creation of compelling, media-friendly content, ensuring alignment with objectives.
	Plan and coordinate press events, conferences, and other public relations activities.
	Represent the organization at industry events, media interviews, and public speaking engagements.
	Track media coverage and report on the effectiveness of PR campaigns and media outreach.
	Analyze trends in media coverage and public opinion to adapt strategies and improve outcomes.
	Lead and mentor junior PR team members, providing guidance and support in their professional development.
	Collaborate with marketing, social media, and other internal teams to ensure cohesive and effective communication strategies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Public Relations, Communications, Journalism, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
	15+ years of experience in public relations, with a focus on media relations and corporate communications.
	Proven track record of developing and executing successful PR campaigns and securing positive media coverage.
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling narratives.
	Strong media relationships with local, national, and trade press.
	Experience in crisis communication and handling sensitive issues.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@choicetalents.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Project Manager Job at WIOCC Nigeria Limited
content:
WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa’s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Objective


	This role oversees planning, implementing and executing individual projects and group-related company projects in a coordinated manner to obtain benefits and control.


Key Duties & Responsibilities
Project Management & Execution:


	Lead and manage WIOCC’s network infrastructure projects to ensure timely and successful completion
	Oversee client orders from pre-sales solution design to final handover, ensuring high levels of client satisfaction
	Develop and maintain project charters, project plans, risk registers, budgets and lessons learned documentation
	Monitor project delivery milestones to ensure alignment with client target timelines


Stakeholder & Client Engagement:


	Collaborate closely with account managers to understand client requirements and ensure project alignment
	Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, providing regular and accurate project updates and reports
	Manage relationships with internal teams, stakeholders and WIOCC clients effectively
	Ensure seamless handovers to internal teams, aligning with client specifications


Cross-Functional Coordination:


	Lead virtual project teams consisting of Engineering, Operations, Legal, Procurement, Logistics and Finance
	Engage and manage third-party suppliers to ensure compliance with client specifications, service level agreements (SLAs), and quality standards
	Address and mitigate project concerns, contractual challenges and risks, escalating issues where necessary


Process & Performance Improvement:


	Actively participate in and promote the project gate review process
	Oversee vendor and logistics management, ensuring timely delivery of materials and services
	Ensure data accuracy within NetSuite and other project management tools
	Serve as a deputy for the Programme Manager as required and contribute to ad-hoc reporting
	Actively participate in process improvement and automation initiatives


Minimum Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent; a master’s degree is an added advantage) in a technical field or equivalent relevant experience
	Must be bilingual (English and French proficiency)
	PMP, PRINCE2, or AGILE certification or equivalent
	Proficient in Microsoft Project


Experience & Skills:


	A minimum of 5 years of technical experience in the telecom industry, with at least 3 years in a project management role
	Strong background in fibre network project management
	Effective project management skills, including experience in written and verbal communication, as evidenced by work history and accomplishments
	Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to summarise and present key information to stakeholders concisely
	Proficiency in using B/OSS tools and experience with the Microsoft Office suite, including MS Project
	Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and solve problems in a fast-paced environment
	Familiarity with WIOCC network technologies, including Subsea, OTN, DWDM, SDH and Data (Ethernet, IP/MPLS, OSPF, BGP), is preferred
	Excellent interpersonal skills, including active listening, negotiation and conflict resolution
	Ability to work cross-functionally and influence teams in a matrix environment


Attributes:


	Strong team leader and manager of virtual teams; motivated, persistent, and able to manage stress
	Client-focused with confidence and relationship-building skills
	Integrity and honesty with high ethical standards and strong negotiation skills
	Passionate, adaptable and flexible
	Committed to personal excellence, accuracy and attention to detail
	Collaborative and results-driven through teamwork and partnerships
	Strong analytical skills with the ability to collate and interpret data from various sources
	Excellent communicator in both English and French, with a natural aptitude for dealing with people
	Creative thinker with excellent problem-solving skills
	Commercially aware, numerate and articulate
	Exceptional network diagnostic skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV including three referees to: applications@wiocc.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Quality Assurance Executive Job at Husk Power Energy Systems Nigeria Limited
keyword: husk power energy systems nigeria limited
content:
Husk is one of the world’s leading rural energy providers. We provide low-cost and reliable power to rural households and businesses, entirely from renewable energy sources. Powering economic possibilities in every village is at the heart of everything we do.

We design, build and operate the lowest cost hybrid (solar and biomass) power plant and distribution network in India and Africa. To date, Husk has provided electricity to over 15,000 homes and business, reducing 95,000 tonnes of CO2. Our aim is to provide 30MW of power to 225,000 customers by 2025, and save 350,000 tonnes of CO2 each year.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Executive
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lafia, Nasarawa
Reports to: Quality Manager

Role Summary


	We are looking to hire an experienced Quality Assurance (QA) Executive who will be responsible for conducting daily quality inspections, ensuring that all materials and work on-site meet project specifications and standards, maintaining quality documentation, assisting in testing and and ensure all new HMG meets all project requirement  and specification before HOTO, and promptly reporting and supporting the resolution of any quality issues during project execution.
	This role reports to the QHSSE Manager and will work in conjunction with the quality and safety procedures of the organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Execute daily QA/QC checks for Hybrid Mini-Grid (HMG) and related rural electrification projects.
	Maintain inspection checklists, quality documentation, and reports
	Support in material receipt inspections at the warehouse and ensure compliance with specifications.
	Assist in testing, commissioning, and documentation for site acceptance Before (HOTO)
	Escalate quality issues and support resolution under guidance of QA manager
	Ensure compliance with internal QA processes and safety protocols


Qualifications
Required Skills & Attributes:


	2 - 5 years of QA/QC experience, preferably in solar or renewable energy projects.
	Bachelors degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering.
	Required certifications such as NEMSA HSSE certificate are desirable
	Working knowledge of solar PV system components and installations.
	Familiarity with ISO 9001, IEC standards, and construction QA/QC procedures.
	Strong attention to detail, reporting, documentation, and communication skills.
	Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with other departments, to promote best practices, and to develop solutions to business challenges
	Experience in construction, tech, solar or similar industries preferred.


Salary
Negotiable based on experience.

title: HR and Admin Executive Job at AT Limited
content:
AT Limited is a dynamic and innovative provider of human capital solutions, specializing in Recruitment, Outsourcing, Consulting, and Business Contracting services. Our mission is to connect businesses with top talent, drive growth, and deliver exceptional results.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR and Admin Executive

Job Location: Asokoro, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an enthusiastic and detail-oriented HR/Admin Officer to join our real estate company in Abuja.
	The ideal candidate must have a strong background in human resource management, recruitment, and employee relations.
	This role requires a proactive professional with excellent organizational skills and the ability to foster a positive work environment while supporting the company’s strategic objectives.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for managing HR functions, including recruitment, onboarding, employee engagement, and compliance with labor regulations.
	This role involves working closely with management to support talent acquisition and employee development initiatives.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the full recruitment cycle, including job postings, candidate sourcing, interviews, and selection.
	Coordinate onboarding processes to ensure smooth integration of new employees.
	Maintain accurate employee records and manage HR databases and systems.
	Administer payroll, benefits, and attendance records in compliance with company policies.
	Conduct performance evaluations and support managers in setting employee goals and development plans.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian labor laws and industry regulations.
	Develop and implement HR policies and procedures to align with organizational goals and legal requirements.
	Facilitate employee training programs and professional development initiatives.
	Handle employee relations, including conflict resolution, grievances, and disciplinary actions.
	Prepare HR reports and analytics to support strategic decision-making.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in HR management, preferably in real estate or a related industry.
	Strong knowledge of HR practices, recruitment strategies, and Nigerian labor laws.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and conflict-resolution skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and HR software (e.g., HRIS or payroll systems).
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
	Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.
	Goal-oriented with a focus on fostering a positive and inclusive workplace culture.
	Certification in HR (e.g., CIPM or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams.


Salary
N100,000 Gross

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: hr.department.atlimited@gmail.com using "Application for HR/Admin Officer" as the subject of the mail.

title: HR / Recruitment Officer Job at Buckler Systems
content:
Buckler Systems is a Nigerian defense solutions provider with strong expertise in manufacturing civilian armored vehicles, design, and prototyping of military vehicles and ordnance equipment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Recruitment Officer
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Talent Acquisition: Lead and manage the full recruitment cycle, including job postings, candidate sourcing, interviewing, and selection.
	Onboarding: Facilitate a seamless onboarding process for new hires, ensuring they are well-integrated into the company culture and equipped for success.
	Employee Relations: Serve as a point of contact for employee queries and issues, fostering a positive and supportive workplace environment.
	HR Administration: Maintain and update employee records, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and legal requirements.
	Performance Management: Support performance appraisal processes, providing guidance and feedback to employees and managers.
	HR Projects: Contribute to the development and implementation of HR initiatives and projects that enhance organizational effectiveness.


Qualifications


	Educational Background: A degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field is preferred.
	Experience: 2-4 years of proven experience in HR and recruitment roles, with a strong understanding of best practices and employment legislation.
	Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Interpersonal Skills: Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships across all levels of the organization.
	Organizational Skills: Strong organizational and multitasking abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
	Problem-Solving Ability: Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive issues with discretion and implement effective solutions.


Why Join Buckler Systems?


	Professional Development: Opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement in a supportive and innovative environment.
	Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values creativity, collaboration, and professional growth.
	Competitive Compensation: Attractive salary and benefits package commensurate with your skills and experience.
	Impactful Work: Contribute to the success of a company that is shaping the future of [Industry/Field].
